org.xadisk.bridge.proxies.interfaces
Interface XASession

All Superinterfaces:
XADiskBasicIOOperations
public interface XASession
extends XADiskBasicIOOperations

This interface, like Session, is used by applications running in non-JCA environments. While Session does not support XA/JTA Transactions, this interface allows applications to use a JTA Transaction Manager to bind XADisk and other XA-enabled resources with a single XA/JTA Transaction. This is possible due to the XAResource implementation returned by the getXAResource method of this interface.

An instance of this interface can be obtained from createSessionForXATransaction.

For applications in JCA environments, use of XADiskConnection interface should be preferable instead of this interface.

Since:
1.1

Method Detail

getXAResource

XAResource getXAResource()
Returns the XADisk implementation of the standard XAResource interface.

This XAResource can be enlisted into an XA/JTA Transaction using enlistResource and hence allows the XASession to participate in the XA/JTA Transaction.

This XAResource implementation is fully compliant with JTA and hence supports features like suspend/resume, one-phase commit optimization, crash recovery, transaction time-out etc.

Returns:
the XADisk implementation of XAResource.
